0.name: JosephIA
0.description: JosephIA is a small artificial intelligence that plays with a user at power 4 and tictactoe. It can also solve a sudoku.

1.name: Advent of Code
1.description: Advent of Code is an Advent calendar of small programming puzzles for a variety of skill sets and skill levels that can be solved in any programming language you like.

2.name: app-Brocoli
2.description: This project was carried out as part of our school year in CIR 2. The aim of this project was to create a CSV or SQL data generator using php to generate the whole site without using JavaScript.

3.name: JosephSlave
3.description: JosephSlave is a discord bot that executes different commands. It was created because I was curious about how a discord bot worked and if it was easy to make one.

4.name: DynamicSimulation
4.description: DynamicSimulation is a personal project used to apply physics lessons. The goal was not to make simple pendulums, but to recreate gravity. Here we have a simple pendulum that swings with time, without any friction. Then we have two double pendulums. A double pendulum is defined as chaotic, because it is very sensitive to initial conditions. To give an example, the two pendulums start the simulation with 1 degree of difference, it's almost imperceptible to the eye, but after 30 seconds of simulation, they start to separate from each other to finally have a completely different oscillation.

5.name: Boids
5.description: In 1986, Craig Reynolds made a computer model of coordinated animal motion such as bird flocks and fish schools.

6.name: LearnStation
6.description: Learnstation is a project realized with 4 friends. The goal of this project was to create a website that references bootcamps focused on programming. The site can be found at this address: http://178.128.161.255:8000

7.name: Jeu de la vie
7.description: The game of life is a simulation of cells that, according to 2 rules, will live or die. In my case, this small project allowed me to better understand the use of arrays and gave me a better code reflection.

8.name: Oximeter de pouls
8.context: As part of our third year at ISEN, we had to create a pulse oximeter. The aim of this project is to recover a 21-bit frame sent by USB link and then calculate the heart rate and the oxygen level in the blood.

9.name: Fractal Simulation
9.description: This fractal simulation is a small project to apply a passage from Daniel Shiffman's book 'The nature of code' where he explains the Koch Curve.

10.name: Pong
10.description: During our second year at ISEN, and in particular during the C++ course, we coded the game of Pong.

11.name: Robot Maze Solver
11.description: As part of our first year at ISEN, and in particular the C course, we coded a small robot that must find the exit in a closed space in a minimum of moves.
